page.title: 12Battlesbridge Antique centre
page.content: The centre consists of several antique shops on the North bank of the River Crouch,(map ref.783986).The buildings were originally mills powered by river water.The disused mills,old shops and a cowshed,were used for the storage of antique furniture.As they were on the busy A130,many people passed by so the resale side began.There is an extremely wide range of goods on sale; small articles of jewellery,pictures, fire places.all types of furniture and even church pews.The antiques come from auctions,private houses but most are bought through the trade.Many antiques are exported to Europe and America.These are some examples of prices:12 seat dining table Â£800, Pedistal desk Â£400,Victorian trumpet work box Â£450,Edwardian chest of drawers Â£85,Pine dresser Â£700.Also antiques are renovated and upholstered
